website_summaries.verdict: If priced a little lower, the Intel 520 Series SSD would be an ideal investment for those who want to greatly improve their computer's overall performance. For now, it's still an excellent drive.
pros: The 2.5-inch Intel 520 Series SSD supports SATA 3 (6Gbps) and offers great performance
The drive is housed in an all-aluminum casing and comes with all you need to use it as a hard-drive replacement for a laptop (ultraportable or standard) or a desktop computer
cons: The Intel 520 Series SSD is comparatively expensive and its low-profile screws are not included

customer_reviews.title: Drop-in replacement for an older spinning disk drive
customer_reviews.text: I needed a drive for a machine that I plan to use for a file-server to access all my cloud accounts locally and enable me to use a network of old Wyse WinTerms to run open source applications on the server. So far, I have not gotten my network set up, but the drive was simple to install and worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: daleraby

customer_reviews.title: This seller is selling used drives as new and they are almost at the end of life cycle
customer_reviews.text: Before installing these drives I noticed discoloration on the aluminum case of both drives. I installed them and did an intel SSD tool Box inspection and found some rather troubling things. Power on cycles : 949667 Hours Host Writes: 6473.13 GB Timed Workload Media Wear: 65535 Total LBs Written: 6473.13 GB Total LBs Read: 496.09 GB Total NAND Writes: 16020.00 GB No wonder people are having failed drives from this seller. Very close to the end of life cycle
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Martin

customer_reviews.title: Fast, fast, fast...did I say...FAST?
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these in 128GB, 240GB, and now 480GB. I'd been putting off SSD for years thinking the technology wasn't there yet, but when Intel released these, and slapped on a 5yr warranty - I thought I should give it a shot. These are so fast it's a joke to go back to spindled drives. 128 went in my laptop...240 went in my desktop. Realized I want more space...so the 480 goes in the desktop, 240 goes to my laptop, and 128 goes into a new laptop I just purchased for my better half. Battery life went up significantly with my laptop as well as these draw so little power... Very fast. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: jenksdrummer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: First off, i like the brand Intel - very reliable and they stand by their products. I bought this as a replacement for Intel 320 series since I needed more disk space so i thought of moving to a newer model.There's not much noticeable performance difference to be honest (windows experience rating went from 7.6 to 7.9) and it may be too early to tell if the BSOD has been eliminated. I was having BSOD with Intel 320, about 3 occurrences in the past 10 months. Not entirely sure if it were a software issue or a HW (SSD?) problem. I've been using this 520 for about 3 weeks now and so far so good. I'm happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: M PoGi

customer_reviews.title: 2012 MacBook Pro 13
customer_reviews.text: I installed a fresh copy of OSX 10.8.2. I also installed the latest version of Intel's Firmware which was dated November 27, 2012 v 1.93. The installed memory is 16 GB. The boot time is 12 seconds. This is the second Intel SSD that I own. The first one was an X25-M was purchased on 02/25/2010 and works very well with no problems since installation, I use both computers for business. Despite being a new and very expensive technology, my first drive has proven to be reliable. I still back up data frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Failed in under four months
customer_reviews.text: This drive failed in under four months, but it worked well until it failed. Unfortunately can't justify more than one star for an expensive, failed hard drive that resulted in complete data loss. Fortunately I do not trust SSDs (or hard drives in general) and had backed up all important files. Be sure to back up your files since the drive will fail eventually and may fail a lot sooner than you expect.
customer_reviews.author: gettys

customer_reviews.title: Very Fast
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an upgrade for my Alienware M17xr2. Unfortunately that particular model only supports SATA-II, but I decided to go with this in case I buy a new machine soon. It gives excellent speeds and has made a huge difference in performance. I had trouble choosing due to the deluge of similar-sounding SSD's, but I chose this one because it's an Intel that carried excellent reviews and benchmarks, plus, I liked the sound of the 5-year warranty. I also like the Intel SSD Toolbox software that you can download from Intel for managing your drive. I am not disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Tsukiakari

customer_reviews.title: W O W
customer_reviews.text: OK, let's make this simple. SSD drives have three important qualities: speed, reliability, and cost. At least one will always be "not as good" as the competition. In this case, these Intel 520 drives are more expensive than the competition. But if you need reliability and speed and can afford to pay slightly more these drives are absolutely worth it. To me, my data's reliability is most important, with speed in second position. These drives are top of the line in those two areas. I don't mind paying a little more for the impressive quality built into this drive. Just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: poddie

customer_reviews.title: Speed like never before
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it is my new computer or this solid-state drive, but I have never had a computer (Dell business model) run as well as this one. My IT guru recommended this upgrade since I tend to leave "everything" open on my computer, 24/7. Said since I will not close out anything, I needed a solid state that would work to my style. This did the trick. The only change I would make is upgrading to the larger capacity next time around. Definitely worth the price in time already saved working at the speed of lightning!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Ulrich

customer_reviews.title: Speedy Installation and Performance
customer_reviews.text: Installation of this SSD was quick and easy with the included mounting bracket. The performance increases were decent in the Ubuntu-running Pentium D system it was installed. It must be mentioned, obviously you should not get this if you need massive quantities of disk space and only have one drive bay. However, if you aren't trying to store massive amounts of music, movies, etc. and just need something to hold your OS, apps, and a few documents, I wouldn't hesitate to use one of these.
customer_reviews.author: David Burnette

customer_reviews.title: So far Great
customer_reviews.text: The operating system has head room now ! and is working flawlessly. If you ever need to switch your operating system to another new drive do your self a favor and but Acronis Tru-Imedge 2013. In 8 minutes after I updated the firm ware the whole " Horrible " as it used to be,,,job was done ! And I have the old " C " drive as storege. Both test out excellant,,,,,and that was just befor Christmas. :>)
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Still running great.
customer_reviews.text: I got this just shy of a year ago. No issues with a failure or other signs of wear. Very fast and stable SSD. My boot time is around 15 seconds, but that is only because I have to chainload from a DOS script for my eGPU (I'll spare the long-winded writeup of what is going on). Will need to get a larger drive in the future though, I find 60GB to get rather tight (even though I have another 500GB drive for storage (which is also full). Intel drives are certainly worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Grant M

customer_reviews.title: Fast & reliable
customer_reviews.text: Fast and easy to use software online to clone you're old hard drive worked perfectly on Win 7 Ultimate and Pro. Boot time is less then 15 seconds Gigabyte P67 MB I7 2600K. I'm glad I made the move solid state and Intel is the way to go. Bench marks were not as high in some cases as advertised but the read and writes were very good scores. This SSD also doubled my Passmark bench score to over 5100. Great Intel technology at work!
customer_reviews.author: DanBoTop Contributor: Archery

customer_reviews.title: Intel 520
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Intel 520 series solid-state drive on Friday November 29, 2013 based on my MIS consultant. We received it on Thursday December 5, 2013, my MIS consultant installed it on Friday December 6, 2013 and dropped it off on December 7, 2013. The speed was what I needed. The solid state drive is so much faster with Microsoft Office products-Outlook & Excel also Adobe Acrobat XI Pro. Downloading client files and pics are so much quicker. I prepare large cost accounting reports and it is saving me time. This is the best new CY 2013 product (Intel 520 series solid-state drive 240 GB ) . Thanks, Merry Christmas & Happy New Year Bill Tierney
customer_reviews.author: William E. Tierney

customer_reviews.title: Great drive, but no noticeable improvement on document loading
customer_reviews.text: I use a lot of modeling tools, like ERwin, and I was hoping that, as my documents got bigger and took longer to load, that an SSD would speed it up. But it didn't. The load must be mostly tied up in ERwin's conversion of data to GUI display. Still, SSDs have sped up my PostgreSQL databases, very noticeably. I hope to test other DBMSs on it.
customer_reviews.author: alendar

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement in speed
customer_reviews.text: Putting in a SSD really speeds up your computer, but it can be a lot of work. I had two raid disks and found out that I could not copy from one of those to the new SSD. Maybe it is possible but I could not figure out how to do it. I had to start installing everything from scratch. That includes special drivers and everything you want to keep.
customer_reviews.author: Gunnar Hovstadius

customer_reviews.title: Very fast boot up
customer_reviews.text: Great way to speed up your system. Once I installed Win7 and all of the necessary drivers and software my system is ready to go in about 12 seconds. Comes with some nice software to manage your disk. I was unable to transfer my existing drive to this ssd due to my lack of knowledge regarding cloning software. My old hdd was a GPT disk which most of the free cloning software do not like to copy. I was forced to complete a fresh install of Windows in order to use the new drive.
customer_reviews.author: Jadrum38

customer_reviews.title: finger crossed
customer_reviews.text: First install of Win 8, BSOD on every boot. Tested the drive in Lenovo W530, and it won't pass SMART test. Reinstalled WIN 8, so far every thing seems in order and no BSOD (knock on the wood) what so ever. If it WIN 8 continues to be reasonably stable, I'll offically forget about the SMART thing. BTW, the speed is something once you tried, you won't be able to get back to platters.
customer_reviews.author: Dimension

customer_reviews.title: Excellant SSD
customer_reviews.text: I ws willing to pay a little more for the reliability of this SSD. I tried a low cost SSD and always had soft errors that eventually casued a repairs of the operating system. Ran all sorts of debig tools on the cheap SSD but debug never reported a problem. The Intel Drive fixed my problems and is much faster.
customer_reviews.author: Skipar

customer_reviews.title: Intel always rocks
customer_reviews.text: Intel always rocks on their products. Never the cheapest, but rare failure.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Starcher

customer_reviews.title: Only one reason I didn't give 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Only one reason I didn't give 5 stars: - No detailed instructions about how to activate raid volume acceleration. Once you realize that it has to go into the same raid ports it works. Otherwise it won't show in Intel software disk management. I will try maximized mode once I get confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ehmig

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: After 2 out of 5 Crucial M4 512GB SSDs failed they were replaced with the Intel 520 480GB drives. So far they work perfectly but its only been a couple of weeks. So far 3 out of the 5 Crucials are fine but one failed in the first week and another in a month. They just disappeared and were not recognized anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Al

customer_reviews.title: Intel 520 Series SSH
customer_reviews.text: My PC runs better then the day I got it. Unbelievable how fast it is! Tired of the one to three minutes of booting and getting to your programs? My Dell PC now takes less than 30 seconds from start button to work programs I select. I'm extremely happy with the upgrade....
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth E Huffaker

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Drive for DIY Computing Projects
customer_reviews.text: I needed a fast portable drive for a DIY portable hard drive--and this thing is perfect, I've also used this drive for Linux projects as well and it works great in Linux as well :)
customer_reviews.author: Team Chang

customer_reviews.title: Quick, reliable
customer_reviews.text: This drive works flawlessly. What more can I say? 180 gigs is plenty for a C drive. I'm currently using less than 60 gigs. Boot speed? From power on to Win 8.1 desktop, it was ready in just under 30 seconds. Blazing.
customer_reviews.author: Neustocks

customer_reviews.title: this is a great drive. I installed my OS on this thing ...
customer_reviews.text: Hay, this is a great drive. I installed my OS on this thing and my old Dell is a whole new machine. It is much quicker to boot and all apps run much quicker on it. I'm sold on SSD. My sata drives are only used for data now.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Smoking Fast!
customer_reviews.text: I really don't have another SSD to compare this to but I've had this installed for a few months so far and haven't had any problems with it. I can't believe how fast it boots up compared to my other hard drive! I ended up using the SSD for my operating system and putting all my files, etc on my old HDD.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Speed and Reliability
customer_reviews.text: I went with the Intel SSD as their QA testing cycle is significantly longer than some of the cheaper brands. So far I've noticed dramatically improved speeds when copying files, opening applications and booting Windows 7. I've had no crashes so far.
customer_reviews.author: piclopse

customer_reviews.title: completest ssd kit yet
customer_reviews.text: product arrived exactly on schedule. though the supplied cd was nigh on needless and useless, the recommended migration software was very easy to download and install. migration from the incumbent hard drive was a breeze, and my windows experience index has grown from 5.9 to 7.8... my intel core i7 3930k is now the slowest part of the system... the package came with all that was needed for the installation, cables, bracket, screws and all... quite nice in all... kudos to intel...
customer_reviews.author: Umar Odeh Adejoh

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure you know how awesome SSD's are so I'm not going to explain that. I use it it a desktop PC for my OS and applications and have standard hard drives for media. I've been using it for over a year and have had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: OMG died today October 2012 - September 15
customer_reviews.text: 500 + read 250 - 500 write depending on file type the write uses compression for faster speeds . I have not had any issues so far 2 months so far and I copied 1.72 TB to it so far according to SMART Details. Still going strong :( Died Today September 14 2014 with out any sign or warning
customer_reviews.author: Dj M

customer_reviews.title: Blazing fast and reliable
customer_reviews.text: My Windows 7 boot time went from roughly a minute to under 15 seconds after installing this speed demon. The general response time for desktop experience, launching apps all have slight improvement as well. Absolutely loved it! and it's an Intel, you can never go wrong with them because of their rock solid firmwares. My laptop runs 24/7 and never has a hiccup, and now it is even more stable, and much faster.
customer_reviews.author: Skycow

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this SSD to upgrade my MSI GT70 laptop. It is smokin' fast and has the Intel 5 year warranty to boot. I have move it around several times and had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: S. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: love it hate it but love it more
customer_reviews.text: love it hate it but love it more its ssd so i dont use it as a backup and without a backup ever. as ssd can fail however its fast and you cant beat the power savings in a whole day use.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ordon Personal

customer_reviews.title: Its a great product, need I say more
customer_reviews.text: Its intel, its lighting fast, heavy duty, sturdy, and feels solid to the touch,(no pun intended) This you can tell they didn't use cheep parts to put this together, and it hasn't let me down yet. Got it fix behind the motherboard, and there are no overheating problems. Its a good pick
customer_reviews.author: profinus

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD
customer_reviews.text: Top of the line when I bought it, still functioning super fast today. This is a great SSD. Recommend buying this as your next computer upgrade if you are contemplating, HDDs are the weakest link and getting an SSD is a huge upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: easy to install...
customer_reviews.text: i replaced an 80 gig sdd with this 240. it was easy to do. i had to reinstall the operating system and all my software, but i saved myself big bucks by upgrading rather then getting a new lap top. i am happy
customer_reviews.author: Home In VA

customer_reviews.title: Once you go SSD, you never go back
customer_reviews.text: Pro's- Price was very competitive (under $380) Capacity is great- 240 can get cramped 480 allows most to put all programs on one drive Fast, fast, fast Warranty Cons- ya, right
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Improves PC performance. Downloaded tool from Intel website that made it easy to transfer OS from HDD to SSD. Painless process. Boot time and application start time is dramatically improved. Wakes up fast from sleep.
customer_reviews.author: naknomik

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I had a 120 GB Intel 520 SSD, and was nearly full. Decided to buy this 240 GB, and use the two drives together, rather than buying the more expenseive 480 GB SSD, and selling the 120 GB. The drive is fast, silent, and the maintenance software works great.
customer_reviews.author: San Diego Gary

customer_reviews.title: hard to die! and running
customer_reviews.text: this intel ssd is pretty fast,i can copy a dvd image from it to a usb 3 drive in just a couple of second ,read over 530 mb/s and write abobe 540 mb/s,in sata 6 gb/s!!.expect 200 mb/s or less in sata 3 gb/s!
customer_reviews.author: Serj

customer_reviews.title: Excellent HDD
customer_reviews.text: High speed drive. Maintenance and data transfer software is excellent. Significant improvement over earlier drives. Drive us well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Roy A. Thornock

customer_reviews.title: 14 Months And Still Going...
customer_reviews.text: I happened to notice I never reviewed this product after I bought it in September 2012. I have two of them in RAID0 on X79 board and haven't had one ounce of trouble. When they were new I got over a Gbps transfer speeds. A year later with no trim support & I still get 900+ Mbps transfer. These are rock solid drives. They cost a little more, but are well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Carden

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance and good value.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my Dell desktop with this drive and have been very happy. Windows 8 boots to desktop in about 8 seconds
customer_reviews.author: V0X

customer_reviews.title: makes an already great computer better
customer_reviews.text: just adds to my already fast setup booting has been cut to almost nothing and its great that when you click on a program its up before you finishing your second mouse click. now if only it could keep my house clean an make dinner it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: shiroren8

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Out of site and out of mind. I have two computers and I don't remember which one has this particular ssd. But both coputers are alot faster than when they had mechanical drives. Ssd's is the way to go for boot drives.
customer_reviews.author: luis

customer_reviews.title: if you are looking for improvement
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking into increasing your laptop performance, the SSD is the way to go. one year using this produce without any issue
customer_reviews.author: Siper

customer_reviews.title: MY SSD
customer_reviews.text: The Specs for the Intel 520 series speak for themselves. I tested this SSD on my personal computer and to my surprise I found that the performance comes very close to the advertised specs. Go ahead and get this one you will not be disappointed. HB
customer_reviews.author: Holger Bruning

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: exact fit os windows 10 easy install from windows usb
customer_reviews.author: charles wessley

customer_reviews.title: Great drive
customer_reviews.text: Got the 480GB drive on sale and it's been great. I replaced a 128GB Crucial C300 SSD because I was running out of room on it. The software to clone the drives from Intel is Acronis true image and worked great for me going from the 128GB drive to the 480GB drive.
customer_reviews.author: Carmmond

customer_reviews.title: SSD Speeds up Laptop Big Time
customer_reviews.text: SSD greatly sped up the performance of my corporate laptop. The trick was finding a SATA adapter that could be used to do the cloning. Once you are past that, the cloning process worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Gregory

customer_reviews.title: great drive
customer_reviews.text: this solid state drive is really good if you want speed on your gaming computer! if you have a powerfull gaming computer this drive must be in it!
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Runs strong and fast. Purchased it over 2 years ago. INTEL rules.
customer_reviews.author: Sebot

customer_reviews.title: Better Reliability than others.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these in a raid for vmware view and they are working well. This is a repeat sale. I bought others several months ago.
customer_reviews.author: CBO

customer_reviews.title: Night and Day Diffrence
customer_reviews.text: Put this into a pre 2010 Macbook Pro and it really made it act like a new generation computer. Highly suggested.
customer_reviews.author: NeoUnity

customer_reviews.title: A great choice of SSD HD
customer_reviews.text: No surprise in buying HD SSD. Reliable, easy to install and great performance at an honest price Low power consumption High speed data transfer zero noise
customer_reviews.author: Antonio E.

customer_reviews.title: Great service!
customer_reviews.text: I like the price and the speed of this hard drive, the only cons i have on this hard drive is that is not reliable on sleep mode, also the migration software is useless did not let me copy the c:drive it wants to pick the entire disk 1tb the only reason i give 4 stars is for the seller great price and shipping
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and fantastic service
customer_reviews.text: Received the SSD 520 240gb on time and followed the instructions provided to install and migrate data from my HHD. When finished everything worked perfectly. The new SSD drive is so much faster than the HHD. I kept the old HHD in machine to use for auto backups.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: but the usual Intel well made protect with great software for viewing stats
customer_reviews.text: Not the fastest compared to the Samsung drives, but the usual Intel well made protect with great software for viewing stats etc
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly fast and great quality
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for over 7 months now and it has been a great replacement for my standard hard disks. I also have a Samsung and this is significantly faster.
customer_reviews.author: H. Fanisalek

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not the fastest Intel SSD's but still very good for general purposes!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence C. Hoyt

customer_reviews.title: nice buy!
customer_reviews.text: It's intel and an SSD that kick's ass what more can i say =)
customer_reviews.author: anthony hallock

customer_reviews.title: Hight performance
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my older HDD with Intel 520 Series SSD on my Lenovo Thinkpad W500 and it improved the performance dramatically eventhough the machine has SATA II interface not 6-Gb/s SATA. The only downside that the purchase does not give to option to select the desktop migration kit or labtop migration kit.
customer_reviews.author: Hossam Katory

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Raid 0 bench marked 1gb/s read rating. I connect first in every multi-player game. I got it on sale, otherwise I say a bit pricey.
customer_reviews.author: A & S Ray

customer_reviews.title: excellent and good speed
customer_reviews.text: This item is excellent and good speed from the reality of experience Boot to the desktop only 19 seconds The packaging was very good The shipping was fast This information that I have I hope I am that my comment was good
customer_reviews.author: MOHAMAD

customer_reviews.title: So far it's great.
customer_reviews.text: I have both the Intel 510 and Intel 520 in my system and to be honest without doing benchmarks I can't tell the difference between the two. Both are great drives and knowing how long Intel held off before releasing a SandForce 2 controller based SSD is very reassuring and the 5 year warranty helps even more.
customer_reviews.author: Norbs

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement HD!
customer_reviews.text: Great drive! Replaced the HD in my Mac and the speeds were very noticeable. Along with a memory upgrade, it has extended the usefulness of my Macbook Pro (Mid 2009) a couple of more years. Completely worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: James McClimans

customer_reviews.title: solid state drive is cool!
customer_reviews.text: My old computer had the typical hard drive. Over time, it began throwing off so much heat, I was having multi-problems and nearly lost all my data. Bought a new computer, had the solid-state drive installed and LOVE IT. Quiet, cool and problem free.
customer_reviews.author: computer non-literate

customer_reviews.title: Intel 520 Series Solid-State Drive 240 GB 6 Gb/s 2.5 inch
customer_reviews.text: This (as ANY SSD) is MUCH faster than a regular hard drive. But Intel makes solidly good products. I feel that the money spent is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Lee_Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Five year warranty
customer_reviews.text: With OS Windows 7! This is the best of the best(Intel) in my book! I owned Samsung and others that were cheaper but customer service is what you want when you spend a few hundred bucks. Not to mention your data. I had an Intel X25 that was very good but it failed with a battery issue (not the SSD fault). Intel replaced hassel free in a few days with free shipping
customer_reviews.author: Waterford

customer_reviews.title: 7200 rpm Win XP 32 Bit pro to Win 7 64 Bit Pro SS Intel MB should've been a faster ungraded system?
customer_reviews.text: 7200 rpm Win XP 3 2Bit pro to Win 7 64 bit Pro SS Intel MB should've been a faster ungraded system? Somewhat disappointed these two upgrades are not faster than I expected, but system freezes up less than before. Video rendering is faster, and heavy apps run better, but normal stuff/boot-up seems the same. Explorer to Chrome browser was a much better, Free upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: It all started with a Kenwood turntable

customer_reviews.title: MacBook Pro Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Added this drive as a MacBook Upgrade. Totally the perfect product to make your mac feel like a brand new product.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: A solid performer
customer_reviews.text: This transformed my old Quad core computer. Windows 7 system. The computer start time is about 20 seconds. I am liking it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: I love it but wish I had got one with more space
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would've gotten a bigger ssd, I put windows on it and my computer boots up in less then 10 seconds. Its worth every penny my only problem was I wish I would've gotten a bigger one
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Wilson

customer_reviews.title: want a bigger one.
customer_reviews.text: in a word INTEL. the only con is I could not afford a bigger one. so price is an issue, but they are coming down slowly.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling C.

customer_reviews.title: Intel SSD
customer_reviews.text: The drive installed easily. The Intel software configured & updated. It has been running non-stop for over three weeks, no problems to date. High through-put. I would recommend this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My 520 - 480GB just died. Lost everything and Intel tools was reported 100% of lifetime available
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment, yesterday I noticed slow write/reads, but Today it was dead, lost everything in the drive, can't even boot it in another computer, nothing, just as it had no power. Had it for a year and paid over $800 for it. These drives are still not ready for the end user with only 1 of these unless you have 2 or 4 in a raid 1 or 10. Hope I can get a replacement, but having pass about a year I doubt it.
customer_reviews.author: Federico

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD
customer_reviews.text: Good drive, great speeds, a tad pricey but i guess the reliability and the Intel brand name does make up for it. Using it on my laptop,
customer_reviews.author: JoyMazon

customer_reviews.title: Intel is good
customer_reviews.text: It arrived as described, and worked well on my dell precision m4700 as an upgrade. The price is reasonable for this used item, and it looks just like new
customer_reviews.author: Tao Luo

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly fast
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this product. Boots into Windows 7 Pro in 10 seconds. What a difference this SSD makes. You should order one today!!!
customer_reviews.author: SueB

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Fast Boot Time!
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly Fast Boot Time! I bought this drive to upgrade my Lenovo Thinkpad W520, installation was easy. I did not used the migration utility as wanted to try fresh install with the SSD. I would recommend fresh/clean install of the OS with the new SSD. I have a windows 8 OS with core i 7, now my boot time is 25 seconds approx.
customer_reviews.author: Tech User

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: It made my laptop to be what it was meant to be, a speed machine. Plus it was more gigs than my machine originally offered in SSD at purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett W Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Intel Data Management software made cloning the existing disk pretty simple. Great improvement in performance. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: Works fine- will buy more as long as prices keep dropping Specs were great and came close to expected speed
customer_reviews.author: Robert Leiva

customer_reviews.title: Intel 520 SSD
customer_reviews.text: Put this in my mid 2010 27" iMac with pressure plate and stock wires bought here on amazon. My iMac now boots from "cold start" in 10sec!!!! Huge difference in app load time as well. Speed Demon.
customer_reviews.author: shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: I put this bad boy in my old sony VAIO FZ285u (2007 model) ...
customer_reviews.text: I put this bad boy in my old sony VAIO FZ285u (2007 model) and the difference in performance is insane! The laptop boots up in seconds instead of endless minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Ignacio Perez Puelles

customer_reviews.title: win7 and win8
customer_reviews.text: Windows7 works fine and detect, but it is harder for on windows8.It is super fast, quiet and less heat. Look durability.
customer_reviews.author: Son Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Expected
customer_reviews.text: This by far beats any normal hard drive but when it comes to preformance and relaibilty compared to other drives this is not something you should look at read speeds at 400mbs and write at 220mbs not as advertised. I am on a mac, startup times are about 10 seconds though and i like that
customer_reviews.author: dominic

customer_reviews.title: Die after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: After using for 2 weeks, It cannot be recognized the drive. It seems to be defective and DOA. I have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: panheritage

customer_reviews.title: Much Faster
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to install this ssd, taking that it is my first ssd. I thought it would be an easy installation, but i wasn't able to re-image my old hd to this one. Instead, I decided to dual boot my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: David Alan To

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for main drive but a little small for the price next time will go with at least the 120 GB
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Head

customer_reviews.title: Works great in a Mac computer
customer_reviews.text: Works great in a Mac computer but don't try it in a older laptop Windows computer. Quite often it simply doesn't work. Check with your manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: W. Zimmermann

customer_reviews.title: 240 GB Intel 520 SSD BSOD Crashed my Vista Laptop Dozens of Times!
customer_reviews.text: In that I have had a 120 GB Intel 320 SSD in my Win 7 desktop for over a year with great performance and no problems I decided to have the 240 GB Intel 520 SSD professionally installed in my Vista Laptop and that is when the problems started and the laptop began having BSOD crashes several times each day. By the end of 2 weeks the BSOD crashes were just 5-10 minutes apart and I had to have the 240 GB Intel 520 SSD removed. Now that the original 240 GB WD Scorpio HDD is back in the laptop there have been no crashes at all which is typical with this laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C.

customer_reviews.title: Was sent an ssd with half the memory ordered.
customer_reviews.text: I received the 120 gigabyte version after ordering the 240gb version. No resolution to this issue to date. Buy elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Insub
